This Canon A1 T-shirt is one of a series of seven by Yukio Miyamoto.
Any colour as long as it is black, the Canon A1, introduced in 1978.

column3: >Arguably the camera that kicked off an era of intense competition and innovation in the development of super competent partially electronic SLRs between the Japanese manufacturers&nbsp
column4: (Nikon, Pentax, Olympus, Minolta, Yashica) that revolutionised and democratised photography
column5: through automating aperture, shutter speed, one or the other or both.&nbsp
column6: In the process the once dominant West German camera industry was decimated. &nbsp

column3: >It is said of sound amplification rubbish in rubbish out &ndash
column4: amplifiers only make what you put into them louder, they do not enhance it.&nbsp
column5: To a significant extent the same applies to artwork and its reproduction.&nbsp
column6: Yukio Miyamoto's simulations and 3D models of cameras are beautifully realised, we reproduce them at 1440 dpi.&nbsp
column7: The files when we send them to the printer are typically about a giga byte in size.&nbsp
column8: The result is an extraordinary expression of enthusiasm and admiration.
